title: danieleither
author: danieleither
content: I'm considering a small new setup, however the location is noise sensitive, therefore I am considering the use of immersion. Can anybody recommend any off-the-shelf packages and or reputable suppliers?

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: danieleither on August 06, 2023, 09:07:09 PMI'm considering a small new setup, however the location is noise sensitive, therefore I am considering the use of immersion. Can anybody recommend any off-the-shelf packages and or reputable suppliers? All I can say is I tried Octominer they held my money for 6 months then refunded it to me. They claimed they could not ship it.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: danieleither on August 06, 2023, 09:07:09 PMI'm considering a small new setup, however the location is noise sensitive, therefore I am considering the use of immersion. Can anybody recommend any off-the-shelf packages and or reputable suppliers? And how many ASICs do you want to buy for mining?If this is a small number of asics, then consider the possibility of installing noise boxes. If you cool the liquid with a radiator, then you will also have additional noise. With noiseboxes, you will start mining faster.Tests in this posthttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5460374.msg62648349#msg62648349

comments.author: danieleither
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on August 06, 2023, 09:26:39 PMQuote from: danieleither on August 06, 2023, 09:07:09 PMI'm considering a small new setup, however the location is noise sensitive, therefore I am considering the use of immersion. Can anybody recommend any off-the-shelf packages and or reputable suppliers? And how many ASICs do you want to buy for mining?If this is a small number of asics, then consider the possibility of installing noise boxes. If you cool the liquid with a radiator, then you will also have additional noise. With noiseboxes, you will start mining faster.Tests in this posthttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5460374.msg62648349#msg62648349It will be 21 miners. I was considering using a dcx immersion system. Noiseboxes, with all due respect, I think are more for hobbiest / bedroom miners.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: danieleither on August 10, 2023, 12:39:07 PMQuote from: FP91G on August 06, 2023, 09:26:39 PMQuote from: danieleither on August 06, 2023, 09:07:09 PMI'm considering a small new setup, however the location is noise sensitive, therefore I am considering the use of immersion. Can anybody recommend any off-the-shelf packages and or reputable suppliers? And how many ASICs do you want to buy for mining?If this is a small number of asics, then consider the possibility of installing noise boxes. If you cool the liquid with a radiator, then you will also have additional noise. With noiseboxes, you will start mining faster.Tests in this posthttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5460374.msg62648349#msg62648349It will be 21 miners. I was considering using a dcx immersion system. Noiseboxes, with all due respect, I think are more for hobbiest / bedroom miners. Emmersion cooling system is convenient to use where you can use the heat from ASICs. For a few ASICs, I would use noiseboxes. An immersion cooling system requires more control and attention, and off-the-shelf options are very expensive. If you do this system yourself, then there are other risks with overheating or shutdown or leaks in the system.

comments.author: philipma1957
comments.body: Quote from: danieleither on August 10, 2023, 12:39:07 PMQuote from: FP91G on August 06, 2023, 09:26:39 PMQuote from: danieleither on August 06, 2023, 09:07:09 PMI'm considering a small new setup, however the location is noise sensitive, therefore I am considering the use of immersion. If you cool the liquid with a radiator, then you will also have additional noise. With noiseboxes, you will start mining faster.Tests in this posthttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5460374.msg62648349#msg62648349It will be 21 miners. I was considering using a dcx immersion system. Noiseboxes, with all due respect, I think are more for hobbiest / bedroom miners. I got a guy in Long Island NYhe is building special racks for s19s to dip the gear in liquid tanks.I will pm you contact info.pm sent!

comments.author: Gabrics
comments.body: Don't forget, that immersion itself won't eliminate waste heat. It will only make it more efficient to remove the heat from the miners.So you will still need to "vent" the heat somewhere (eg. cool down the water). One quite solution is underground pipe system. But you will need a LOT of pipes to transfer that much heat.

comments.author: mikeywith
comments.body: Quote from: danieleither on August 10, 2023, 12:39:07 PMIt will be 21 miners. I was considering using a dcx immersion system. Noiseboxes, with all due respect, I think are more for hobbiest / bedroom miners. What is it that you don't like about DCX tanks? Anyway, their kits seem to have the lowest noise levels, their dry coolers are pretty good, but the overall system is over priced.Foghashing is probably the best in terms of overall value, god products and good prices, they have the 120kw kit which can handle 24 new gen miners, total cost is roughly 17k, FOB china, including the 750L of coolant.
